result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willow Shalon Williams

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

JA called Defendant to advise her the hearing set for today 10/21/22 was inadvertently cancelled, as there were juvenile matters that were cancelled. Defendant states she contacted the PD's Office earlier today and they still didn't have an atty for her. JA confirmed Defendant's address for mailing a notice of the rescheduled court date. JA also generated a text message for Defendant of the rescheduled hearing date.  gll

DE called to confirm court date. Clerk confirmed date and Zoom information. DE said she had called PD's office today and they still do not have an attorney for her, and they told her she should call back this afternoon after her next court date is scheduled. srb

2:05 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Willow Shalon Williams appeared by video. Court reviews case. Court notes the PD office has not appointed an attorney as of today. Court finds good cause to go beyond prelim time limits. Court sets STC.  Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 02:08 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

JA advised Defendant that the Public Defender's Office requested a continuance of the preliminary hearing on 10/7/22 because they haven't located an atty to appoint. JA further advised that Judge Vlack would still like to keep the hearing on the calendar for 10/7/22 at 2 p.m., but Defendant may appear by Zoom and provided Zoom information.  gll
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to reschedule 10/7 PH. Filed by Atty. Satorius. Per EFV, approved. kma

10:29 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Willow Shalon Williams. Defendant Willow Shalon Williams in court. Court reviews case. Atty Satorius waives prelim time limits. Court sets PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 10:33 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

2:19 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo with Intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Willow Shalon Williams in court. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets STC to check status of PD appointment and to set prelim. Adjourned at 2:23 PM.  gll
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
